content: Salary Career Asked by AnonymousAsked on 29 Nov 2018I just finished serving my sentence, and have been having a lot of trouble getting a job, once people know about my background. What should I do?Basically I was arrested because I was in the wrong company. I have a diploma in accounting. Came out 1 year ago, and haven't been able to find a job since. Nau HauserLevel 3. WonderkidAnswered on 29 Nov 2018I'm sorry to hear that but it's really as much your opinion as others. If you have changed over a new leaf, believe it and go forth and embrace you as you are now ; changed and for the better. We may be a more conservative society but there's many others that are still open and acceptive to your background. Your description is too brief to add more. All the best! Never let others determine who you are.0 comments3

RookieAnswered on 30 Nov 2018go to those wsg connect (if that's the right term) at various places. i know there's one at tampines hub and another at paya lebar. make an appointment and you can go meet an advisor who will help guide you in your resume, networking, and looking for jobs. i know it's easy for me to say there are plenty of opportunities out there but due to your circumstances, you can't afford to be picky. be humble, open to learning and seek help, make the right connections. most importantly, don't give up!0 comments2
